Sentencas: In an attempt to recover waste heat from a system composed of a solid oxide fuel cell and gas turbine, a novel multi-generation system is proposed utilizing five different subsystems and investigated from energy, exergoeconomic, and environmental standpoints.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: The waste heat of the solid oxide fuel cell - gas turbine is recovered by a recompression supercritical CO2 Brayton cycle and a thermoelectric generator, and the total electrical power generated by the supercritical CO2 Brayton cycle and thermoelectric generator is used as the input electricity in a proton exchange membrane electrolyzer to produce hydrogen.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: The residual heat of the exhaust gases and the waste heat of the supercritical CO2 Brayton cycle in the heat rejection stage are respectively recovered in a domestic hot water heat exchanger and an LiCl-H2O absorption refrigeration system which are responsible for the production of heating and cooling.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: The evaluations in a base case demonstrate that the five utilized subsystems bring about a 2.49 and 14.4% points enhancement in the exergy and energy efficiencies of the system, respectively, compared to the combined solid oxide fuel cell - gas turbine system.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: However, they contribute to a 23.57% and 17.7% of the total cost rate and total exergy destruction of the system, respectively.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: The outcomes also reveal that employing the subsystems conduces to a decline in the environmental index and payback period of the whole system.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: The sensitivity analysis indicates that the system has a proper thermoeconomic performance within the range of solid oxide fuel cell outlet temperature between 745 and 765 degrees C.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: The lowest unit cost and the highest exergy efficiency of multi-generation occur at the highest possible pressure ratio of the air compressor.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes

Sentencas: Also, the best economic and environmental performances and the highest exergy efficiency take place at the lowest current density and highest fuel utilization factor equal to 4800 A/m2 and 0.85, respectively.
Titulo: Waste heat recovery of a combined solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system for multi-generation purposes
